cluster_relations.rel_desc: Communities aim to protect their loved ones.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject safeguards or provides protective benefit to the object (actual or intended protection), often against implicit or explicit threats.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Ethical principles aim to protect communities as part of prioritizing their well-being.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject safeguards or provides protective benefit to the object (actual or intended protection), often against implicit or explicit threats.
remarks: Relation derived from the phrase including communities as beneficiaries; somewhat redundant with the composite well-being entity.
Relation derived from the phrase including communities as beneficiaries; somewhat redundant with the composite well-being entity.

args.justification: Both relations describe an agentive safeguarding action (communities or ethical principles acting to protect beneficiaries). This is better modeled as an AGENCY-type relation (an actor exercising protective agency toward a beneficiary) rather than a generic CAUSALITY group, which is more appropriate for impersonal cause–effect links.
args.remark: No change to canonical_rel_name or rel_cls; only the broad semantic dimension is refined from CAUSALITY to AGENCY to emphasize the agentive nature of protection.

executed_decisions.justification: Both relations describe an agentive safeguarding action (communities or ethical principles acting to protect beneficiaries). This is better modeled as an AGENCY-type relation (an actor exercising protective agency toward a beneficiary) rather than a generic CAUSALITY group, which is more appropriate for impersonal cause–effect links.
executed_decisions.remark: No change to canonical_rel_name or rel_cls; only the broad semantic dimension is refined from CAUSALITY to AGENCY to emphasize the agentive nature of protection.
